65_Point_Local_SEO_Checklist.text: ✅ Local SEO Checklist (65 points) by  Localrank.so
Before we get started, Local SEO is stupid easy right now, and that’s because it’s one of the last places AI hasn’t touched.
Google Business Profile Optimization
Claim and Verify Your Google Business Profile (GBP).
Provide a “Real” Address. Make sure it can be consistent everywhere.
Use a Local Phone Number.
Cull Duplicate or Wrong GBP Listings.
Choose the Best Primary Category.
Add Secondary Categories (Up to 9).
Complete Every Section of Your Profile.
List Your Products and Services.
Add Plenty of High Quality Photos (and Videos).
Set a Cover Photo and Logo.
Keep Hours Accurate (Including Holidays).
Use Google Posts (Localrank. so helps with this)
Monitor and Answer Q&A.
Link to the Correct Website URL.
Maintain Profile Health Over Time.
Website & On-Page SEO
NAP + schema on Your Site.
Create a Dedicated Contact/Location Page.
Incorporate Local Keywords in Key Elements.
Include Location Info Site-Wide.
If you’re just starting out and this checklist is going over your head, I’d recommend you go through the Local Rank Academy.
It’s a vibrant community of agency owners doing up to 8-figures in revenue per year.
You’ll get your first paying client in 90 days—or your money back.*
Use LocalBusiness Schema Markup. ( Localrank.so has a free tool )
Embed a Google Map on Your Site. ( Localrank.so has a free tool )
Publish Location-Specific Content.
Optimize for Mobile and Speed.
Implement Clear Calls to Action (CTAs).
Use Testimonials and Trust Indicators.
Regularly Update Website Content. ( Revive.so )
Reviews & Reputation Management
ASK FOR REVIEWS.
Make It Easy to Leave Reviews. (Eg. QR code, pretty urls etc.)
Respond to All Reviews. (Localrank .so can automate this, FREE UNTIL NEXT WEEK)
Get Keywords in Reviews (Can beg for it, but don’t let Google know).
Monitor Your Reputation Beyond Google.
Avoid “Review Gating” and Incentives. (But they won’t know shhhh)
Citations & Local Listings
Audit Your Existing Citations and Listings.
Maintain NAP Consistency Across the Web.
Get Listed on Major Directories and Map Services. ( Localrank.so can do this in 1-click )
Build Citations on Niche and Local Directories. ( Localrank.so can do this in 1-click )
Use Consistent Categories and Descriptions.
Local Link Building
Build Local Backlinks with NAP. (Indexsy has a service that does this,  check out Local Guest Posts on Indexsy )
Sponsor Local Events or Organizations. (Homepage link lol)
Earn Local Press Coverage and PR.
Link Exchange with Local Businesses.
Create Local Resource Content for Backlinks.
Awards link building
Behavioral Signals & User Engagement
Fill Out Your Title Tags & Meta Descriptions.
Make Sure UX is Dece.
Make Your Google Profile CLICKABLE.
USE Google’s Booking & Reservation Features.
Monitor Behavioral Metrics in Analytics.
Encourage Brand Searches and Direct Traffic (VIA ADS OR JOB LISTINGS)
Tracking, Reporting & Tools
Use  Localrank.so  to track your local rankings.
Monitor Google Business Profile Insights. (Useless sometimes though)
Track Reviews and Mentions in One Dashboard. ( Localrank.so  has this)
Set Up Google Search Console for Your Website.
Regular Reporting and Analysis.
Stay Informed on Local SEO Updates. ( Local Rank Academy  baby)
BONUS: Advanced / Grey Hat Tactics
Keyword-Stuff Your GBP Name (Spam Technique).
CTR Manipulation, eg. Airplane mode to reset your IP, then Google your keyword and drive to work
Build or Buy Private Blog Network (PBN) Links.
Mass Google My Business Listings (Spam Locations).
Fake Reviews and Negative SEO on Competitors.
Geo-Tagging and EXIF Tricks on Images.
Using VPNs to Simulate Local Searches.

That's it. I just gave you, a random person I never met, the blueprint to print money. Why? Well,  Localrank.so  is a piece of local seo software, so if you can secure and retain more clients, hopefully you’ll consider using Localrank when the time comes.

Module 2: Local SEO Fundamentals (NAP, Reviews, GMB)
Module 4: Google My Business Setup & Location Strategy

Complete_Rank_and_Rent_Course.text: July 18 EP 587 (The Complete Rank and Rent SEO Course)
What is a rank and rent?

Rank and rent is an SEO strategy where you build and rank a website for specific local keywords, then rent out the site (and its leads) to a business for a monthly fee (could be pay per lead as well).
Very easy to rank so low barrier, recurring revenue, and easy sell
TL;DR just go through localrank’s local lead packs
Search volume x CTR x CR (form fill rate x client conversion) x AOV x Margins x 50%
Lead to client rate is roughly 5%
IF you get 100 leads a month
Domains: TLDR just go with exact match domains

Website setup: if you know how already, just go with generatepress and design it yourself, if you can’t, we’ll do it for you if you host with  https://simplehost.so/ . First designs on us, and you can replicate and change the content yourself.
Site Structure: most sites can get away with single page site since its local keywords VERY EASY
On-Site SEO: Just use chatGPT lol, remember to include your target keyword in H1s and have meta title, maybe FAQ schema + local schema use  ‣
If you can, register a GBP, either legit or not legit
Legit = rent an office in your city etc.
Not legit = pay someone to reg $150-$300 a pop (not recommended)
90% of people will rank #1 directly with citations + foundational links
Foundational links, use the free swipe files found on Local Rank Academy (3000+ sites to build backlinks)
Citations, just use Local Boost + Local Rank citations
After that just use niche edits  https://indexsy.spp.io/order/niche-edits  + BrowserBlast and you’ll get there TRUST
PPL networks or pay per call networks work well, i used ringpartner, was pretty great
There’s a couple ways to pitch your rank and rents…
Cold email (scalable) ← works best for me
Cold call (only if you’re not awkward af and NO ACCENT)
Walk in and pitch (only if you have that chad aura)
Buy domain eg. tryindexsy.com, instead of sending indexsy.com
Create 3 email accounts per domain, eg.  jacky@tryindexsy.com ,  jack@tryindexsy.com ,  jackson@tryindexsy.com
Setup email forwarding eg. all the above should forward to  hello@indexsy.com
Technical setup eg. DMARC and DKIM need to be setup
Leads, can be done via Fiverr or scraped using Outscraper
Subject: Best {{personalization}} (Location) Realtor Listicle on Indexsy.com
I'll be quick, we rank on the front page of Google for the term "best {{personalization}} realtor" and just about every variation of it.
Would you be interested in being included at #1 here?
Subject: quick question {first name} OR quick question OR Deck Builder Quote
We have extra leads who are looking for deck builders in St. Louis.
Do you have the capacity to service an extra 20-25 clients a month?

This isn’t something I’m super confident with, but it’s something where you need to get your reps in. Just pick up the phone and pitch. If you are young, just say that, eg. Hi there, I’m an 18 year old marketer, do you have 5 minutes where I can tell you about how I can make your business show up higher on Google?

If you're using fake GMBs... you’re probably clapped.
2. Tons of real reviews = walk in the park
If a client has way more legit reviews than top snack pack listings?
It means the community loves them — they just need foundational tweaks.
3. High foot traffic + no rankings = goldmine
Businesses with real traffic but no visibility?
They’re likely one small tweak away from blowing up.
Technical issue → fix it → rankings in 7 days.
Check if reviews mention target keywords. If not, that’s a missed opportunity.
Are they replying to reviews? If not, fix it.
Tell them to prompt customers to drop keywords in their reviews. Easy win.
